Class GameContext

java.lang.Object
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.game.GameContext
public class GameContext extends Object
The definition of a game context, a support structure used to provide contextual information to a chess position, and most importantly to validate special moves in a uniform and consistent way according to the chess variation (e.g. castle moves).

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected Move
    blackoo
    The definition of the black king shift in the default short castle move.

    The bitboard representation of all the squares involved in the default short castle move of black.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameContext

      public GameContext()
      Constructs a new game context using the default game mode and chess variation.

      Same as invoking new GameContext(GameMode.HUMAN_VS_HUMAN, VariationType.NORMAL).

    • GameContext

      public GameContext(GameMode gameMode, VariationType variationType)
      Constructs a new game context using the provided game mode and chess variation.
      Parameters:
      gameMode - the game mode
      variationType - the chess variation

  • Method Details

    • getKingCastleMove

      public Move getKingCastleMove(Side side, CastleRight castleRight)
      Returns an unambiguous castle move by king given the provided side and castle rights, if possible. A castle move is not ambiguous if only one side of the board has castle rights, either king-side or queen-side (not both).
      Parameters:
      side - the side to move
      castleRight - the castle rights available for the moving side
      Returns:
      the move representing the castle move of the king, if available and not ambiguous, or null otherwise

    • getRookCastleMove

      public Move getRookCastleMove(Side side, CastleRight castleRight)
      Returns an unambiguous castle move by rook given the provided side and castle rights, if possible. A castle move is not ambiguous if only one side of the board has castle rights, either king-side or queen-side (not both).
      Parameters:
      side - the side to move
      castleRight - the castle rights available for the moving side
      Returns:
      the move representing the castle move of the rook, if available and not ambiguous, or null otherwise

    • isCastleMove

      public boolean isCastleMove(Move move)
      Checks if the move is a castle move or not.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to check
      Returns:
      true if the move is a castle one

    • hasCastleRight

      public boolean hasCastleRight(Move move, CastleRight castleRight)
      Checks if the castle move is valid according to the castle rights.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to check
      castleRight - the castle rights to compare the move against
      Returns:
      true if the castle move is valid

    • isKingSideCastle

      public boolean isKingSideCastle(Move move)
      Checks if the move is a king-side (short) castle move.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to check
      Returns:
      true if the move is a king-side castle one

    • isQueenSideCastle

      public boolean isQueenSideCastle(Move move)
      Checks if the move is a queen-side (long) castle move.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to check
      Returns:
      true if the move is a queen-side castle one
